meanings.definition: To deliberately destroy or damage property.
meanings.sent1: Some naughty kids vandalise the park benches by drawing on them.
meanings.sent2: The graffiti artist decided to vandalise the abandoned building with colorful spray paint.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon seemed to have a secret mission to vandalise the garden gnome collection.
meanings.sent4: The storm's fierce winds seemed to vandalise the peaceful landscape, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The vandals' actions were so extreme that they managed to vandalise an entire playground overnight.

meanings.sent1: The bored students decided to vandalise their textbooks with doodles during class.
meanings.sent2: The old posters on the wall started to peel off, giving the room a vandalised look.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy managed to vandalise the neatly arranged pile of laundry in seconds.
meanings.sent4: The artist's intention was to vandalise the blank canvas with bold strokes of color.
meanings.sent5: The heavy rain seemed to vandalise the freshly painted fence, causing the colors to run together.
